'Make America Great Again' is the simulation of a Trump presidency. Of cause this game is not even trying to be an exact image of Politics, but just an entertaining funny little game. You have to handle the national debt, trade with other countries, defeat ISIS and you can even start wars with other countries. The gameplay gets pretty repetitive after a few hours, but for 3 $ you can`t really expect more. The way the game was done is pretty entertaining. So Trump give you advices how to govern in the best way and if you click on something you will hear some of his quotes. All the other countries are also described pretty funny, you just shouldn`t take it too serious.  And hey, in which other game can you a build a wall and make Mexico pay for it ? ;)   Pro: - You can make America great again - You can make America safe again - You can make America rich again - Valuable Trading cards and funny achievements  - Pretty entertaining   Contra:  -Very simple Simulator/Kind of repetitive -Not that long to beat

While most are just buying this game for the memes or the trading cards, I see this game has potential. This has some great concepts and some strategy involved. Some improvements that I would love to have in this game is: being about to control the helocopter with your mouse, controller capabilities, ability to change donald trump's helocopter's sensitivity, and graphical improvements to the isis enemies. Overall, this feels like a newgrounds flash game. Even with all these problems, I somehow managed to have fun in this game. To people interested in buying this game, I would recommend waiting till this goes on sale.

One of the most realistic depictions of the United States i have ever laid eyes on. This is more realistic than actually being IN the United States. In this game, the goal is to not trigger all the sjws so hard that they start World War Three, and you must build many walls along the way.

You will cry, you will hate, you will learn to love to laugh at Trump's attemps to 'Make America Great Again'. It is satire at it's finest as the game may seem to glorify Trump but his exaggerated nature and pro-America message is a dead give away; critics and Hillary supporters need to calm down and have fun at Trump expense by playing this game instead of rioting in the streets.   Overall, nothing to write home about the graphics, voice acting, or game play. Mostly, the graphics looks like a flash game, voice is just a spliced and paste of Donald's speech to comedic effect (I'm like a chess grand master playing against a checkers child), and game play is about max/min mircomanagement with the point and click combat scenario thrown in involving Trump in the helicopter shooting at ISIS terrorists in CANADA (of all places).   Really fun and funny game as it is one of a fee that had me crying with laughter at the sheer comedic genius of this game. Easy achievements and should last 1-2 hours.

♥♥♥♥ing terrible: -Clunky & confusing - the game is obviously poorly optimized with limited features, anyone can see that right off the bat -Boring; I found myself bored with the game within litterally a few minutes, I played for another half hour before requesting a refund however -The buy/sell system (aka what the game forces you to rely on to progess) is all over the place, and the complete randomization scheme was terrible -'Schmoozing' and 'Threatening' both have barely any effect on the price of products and take a long time to regenerate for what their worth -ISIS battles are unimaginably tedious and SO. ♥♥♥♥ING. BORING. I could say more but, suffice to say, the game is absolute trash.  EDIT: Thank you to the developers for being so kind and understanding, even though -- looking back -- I was quite intense with my review. I think the basis of much of the games confusion and frustation for me was the complete randomization of the market, coupled with how quickly fear and love for America deteriorates. I'm not going to change my review because, in essence, I still agree with what I said, but I do believe the devs care about the game and want to make it better, and I may repurchase in the future if any major changes are made. :)  Thank you again to Cavalry for being so kind in his response even though I was a bit of a ♥♥♥♥.
